groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Planka

attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

enum.description: Postgres 15 (Deprecated)
Postgres 17
Postgres 18

attrs.description: The password for Planka.

attrs.description: The default admin password for Planka.

attrs.label: BaseURL
attrs.description:
The URL that Planka will be accessible from.</br>
Example: </br>
http://server.ip:30034</br>
https://planka.example.com

attrs.label: Trust Proxy
attrs.description: Trust the reverse proxy when Planka is behind a reverse proxy.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Planka files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Planka files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access
Expose port for inter-container communication
None

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Remove Deprecated Storage
attrs.description:
By clicking this button, the deprecated (and unused) storages will be removed (once the deprecation period is over).
All data previously in the deprecated storage should be ALREADY copied to the new Data storage,
by the automatic migration process. Keep the deprecated storages as is, until the deprecation period is over.
This checkbox is just an "acknowledgement" that you are aware of the deprecation and that you want to remove the deprecated storages once the deprecation period is over.
Note that by default the Data Storage points to an iX Volume,
if you want to use a Host Path, you need to stop the application, move the data from the iX Volume
to the Host Path and then edit the application to point to the Host Path.

attrs.label: Avatars Storage (Deprecated)
attrs.description:
This storage is no longer used. It is kept only for the migration process.
All data previously here are COPIED to the new Data storage.
Will be removed in the future.

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)
